summary: This is an internal email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York summarizing a phone call with Jeff Brown, counsel for former Governor Bill Richardson. The call was prompted by allegations against Richardson in recently released civil case depositions related to Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutor clarifies Richardson's status in the investigation and discusses the possibility of a proffer.

keyFacts: Bill Richardson's name appeared in recently released civil deposition papers related to the Jeffrey Epstein case, prompting his attorney to contact federal prosecutors.
The prosecutor informed Richardson's counsel that Richardson was not currently considered a target, nor was he scheduled to be subpoenaed or interviewed at that time.

The prosecutor suggested it would be helpful to receive a proffer from Richardson regarding any knowledge he might have about Epstein, though his counsel indicated Richardson likely had no knowledge of the charged conduct.
The communication shows the U.S. Attorney's Office was fielding inquiries from high-profile individuals named in connection with the Epstein investigation in August 2019.
